text:
Gwyneth Paltrow will put acting on the "backburner" to concentrate on her family.

The Oscar winner is quoted in The Mirror as saying: "I'm not doing another film until next fall. Everything is about family, I'm putting movies on a backburner.

"London is my home for now - this is where we are concentrating our time."

Paltrow recently appeared in comedy drama The Good Night. She will next be seen in Iron Man, which opens in the UK on May 2.

The 35-year-old has two children, three-year-old Apple and one-year-old Moses, with her husband, Coldplay singer Chris Martin.
title: Paltrow putting acting on the "backburner"

og.title: Paltrow putting acting on the "backburner"
og.description: Gwyneth Paltrow is to give up acting to be a full-time mother.
